intro: Blepharis malangensis, commonly known as the Malang grass or Malang plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist or semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and lance-shaped, while the flowers are often clustered in whorls along the stem. Blepharis malangensis is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its delicate appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
